Events.year: 325 – The First Council of Nicaea is formally opened, starting the first ecumenical council of the Christian Church.[1]
Events.html: 325 – The First Council of Nicaea is formally opened, starting the first ecumenical council of the Christian Church.[1]

Events.year: 491 – Empress Ariadne marries Anastasius I. The widowed Augusta is able to choose her successor for the Byzantine throne, after Zeno (late emperor) dies of dysentery.
Events.html: 491 – Empress Ariadne marries Anastasius I. The widowed Augusta is able to choose her successor for the Byzantine throne, after Zeno (late emperor) dies of dysentery.

Events.year: 685 – The Battle of Dun Nechtain is fought between a Pictish army under King Bridei III and the invading Northumbrians under King Ecgfrith, who are decisively defeated.
Events.html: 685 – The Battle of Dun Nechtain is fought between a Pictish army under King Bridei III and the invading Northumbrians under King Ecgfrith, who are decisively defeated.

Events.year: 794 – While visiting the royal Mercian court at Sutton Walls with a view to marrying princess Ælfthryth, King Æthelberht II of East Anglia is taken captive and beheaded.[2]
Events.html: 794 – While visiting the royal Mercian court at Sutton Walls with a view to marrying princess Ælfthryth, King Æthelberht II of East Anglia is taken captive and beheaded.[2]

Events.year: 1217 – The Second Battle of Lincoln is fought near Lincoln, England, resulting in the defeat of Prince Louis of France by William Marshal, 1st Earl of Pembroke.
Events.html: 1217 – The Second Battle of Lincoln is fought near Lincoln, England, resulting in the defeat of Prince Louis of France by William Marshal, 1st Earl of Pembroke.

Events.year: 1293 – King Sancho IV of Castile creates the Estudio de Escuelas de Generales in Alcalá de Henares.
Events.html: 1293 – King Sancho IV of Castile creates the Estudio de Escuelas de Generales in Alcalá de Henares.

Events.year: 1449 – The Battle of Alfarrobeira is fought, establishing the House of Braganza as a principal royal family of Portugal.
Events.html: 1449 – The Battle of Alfarrobeira is fought, establishing the House of Braganza as a principal royal family of Portugal.

Events.year: 1497 – John Cabot sets sail from Bristol, England, on his ship Matthew looking for a route to the west (other documents give a May 2 date).
Events.html: 1497 – John Cabot sets sail from Bristol, England, on his ship Matthew looking for a route to the west (other documents give a May 2 date).

Events.year: 1498 – Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovers the sea route to India when he arrives at Kozhikode (previously known as Calicut), India.[3]
Events.html: 1498 – Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama discovers the sea route to India when he arrives at Kozhikode (previously known as Calicut), India.[3]

links.title: Discovery of the sea route to India

Events.year: 1521 – Ignatius of Loyola is seriously wounded in the Battle of Pampeluna.
Events.html: 1521 – Ignatius of Loyola is seriously wounded in the Battle of Pampeluna.

Events.year: 1570 – Cartographer Abraham Ortelius issues Theatrum Orbis Terrarum, the first modern atlas.
Events.html: 1570 – Cartographer Abraham Ortelius issues Theatrum Orbis Terrarum, the first modern atlas.

Events.year: 1609 – Shakespeare's sonnets are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by the publisher Thomas Thorpe.[4]
Events.html: 1609 – Shakespeare's sonnets are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by the publisher Thomas Thorpe.[4]

Events.year: 1631 – The city of Magdeburg in Germany is seized by forces of the Holy Roman Empire and most of its inhabitants massacred, in one of the bloodiest incidents of the Thirty Years' War.
Events.html: 1631 – The city of Magdeburg in Germany is seized by forces of the Holy Roman Empire and most of its inhabitants massacred, in one of the bloodiest incidents of the Thirty Years' War.

Events.year: 1645 – Yangzhou massacre: The ten day massacre of 800,000 residents of the city of Yangzhou, part of the Transition from Ming to Qing.[5]
Events.html: 1645 – Yangzhou massacre: The ten day massacre of 800,000 residents of the city of Yangzhou, part of the Transition from Ming to Qing.[5]

Events.year: 1775 – The Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence is allegedly signed in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Events.html: 1775 – The Mecklenburg Declaration of Independence is allegedly signed in Charlotte, North Carolina.

Events.year: 1802 – By the Law of 20 May 1802, Napoleon Bonaparte reinstates slavery in the French colonies, revoking its abolition in the French Revolution.
Events.html: 1802 – By the Law of 20 May 1802, Napoleon Bonaparte reinstates slavery in the French colonies, revoking its abolition in the French Revolution.

Events.year: 1813 – Napoleon Bonaparte leads his French troops into the Battle of Bautzen in Saxony, Germany, against the combined armies of Russia and Prussia. The battle ends the next day with a French victory.
Events.html: 1813 – Napoleon Bonaparte leads his French troops into the Battle of Bautzen in Saxony, Germany, against the combined armies of Russia and Prussia. The battle ends the next day with a French victory.

Events.year: 1840 – York Minster is badly damaged by fire.
Events.html: 1840 – York Minster is badly damaged by fire.

Events.year: 1861 – American Civil War: The state of Kentucky proclaims its neutrality, which will last until September 3 when Confederate forces enter the state. Meanwhile, the State of North Carolina secedes from the Union.
Events.html: 1861 – American Civil War: The state of Kentucky proclaims its neutrality, which will last until September 3 when Confederate forces enter the state. Meanwhile, the State of North Carolina secedes from the Union.

Events.year: 1862 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signs the Homestead Act into law, opening 84 million acres of public land to settlers.[6]
Events.html: 1862 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signs the Homestead Act into law, opening 84 million acres of public land to settlers.[6]

Events.year: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of Ware Bottom Church: In the Virginia Bermuda Hundred campaign, 10,000 troops fight in this Confederate victory.
Events.html: 1864 – American Civil War: Battle of Ware Bottom Church: In the Virginia Bermuda Hundred campaign, 10,000 troops fight in this Confederate victory.

Events.year: 1873 – Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis receive a U.S. patent for blue jeans with copper rivets.[7]
Events.html: 1873 – Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis receive a U.S. patent for blue jeans with copper rivets.[7]

Events.year: 1875 – Signing of the Metre Convention by 17 nations leading to the establishment of the International System of Units.
Events.html: 1875 – Signing of the Metre Convention by 17 nations leading to the establishment of the International System of Units.

Events.year: 1882 – The Triple Alliance between the German Empire, Austria-Hungary and the Kingdom of Italy is formed.
Events.html: 1882 – The Triple Alliance between the German Empire, Austria-Hungary and the Kingdom of Italy is formed.

Events.year: 1883 – Krakatoa begins to erupt; the volcano explodes three months later, killing more than 36,000 people.
Events.html: 1883 – Krakatoa begins to erupt; the volcano explodes three months later, killing more than 36,000 people.

Events.year: 1891 – History of cinema: The first public display of Thomas Edison's prototype kinetoscope.
Events.html: 1891 – History of cinema: The first public display of Thomas Edison's prototype kinetoscope.

Events.year: 1902 – Cuba gains independence from the United States. Tomás Estrada Palma becomes the country's first President.
Events.html: 1902 – Cuba gains independence from the United States. Tomás Estrada Palma becomes the country's first President.

Events.year: 1927 – Treaty of Jeddah: The United Kingdom recognizes the sovereignty of King Ibn Saud in the Kingdoms of Hejaz and Nejd, which later merge to become the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
Events.html: 1927 – Treaty of Jeddah: The United Kingdom recognizes the sovereignty of King Ibn Saud in the Kingdoms of Hejaz and Nejd, which later merge to become the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.

Events.year: 1932 – Amelia Earhart takes off from Newfoundland to begin the world's first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean by a female pilot, landing in Ireland the next day.
Events.html: 1932 – Amelia Earhart takes off from Newfoundland to begin the world's first solo nonstop flight across the Atlantic Ocean by a female pilot, landing in Ireland the next day.

Events.year: 1940 – The Holocaust: The first prisoners arrive at a new concentration camp at Auschwitz.
Events.html: 1940 – The Holocaust: The first prisoners arrive at a new concentration camp at Auschwitz.

Events.year: 1941 – World War II: Battle of Crete: German paratroops invade Crete.
Events.html: 1941 – World War II: Battle of Crete: German paratroops invade Crete.

Events.year: 1948 – Generalissimo Chiang Kai-shek wins the 1948 Republic of China presidential election and is sworn in as the first President of the Republic of China at Nanjing.
Events.html: 1948 – Generalissimo Chiang Kai-shek wins the 1948 Republic of China presidential election and is sworn in as the first President of the Republic of China at Nanjing.

links.title: President of the Republic of China

Events.year: 1949 – In the United States, the Armed Forces Security Agency, the predecessor to the National Security Agency, is established.
Events.html: 1949 – In the United States, the Armed Forces Security Agency, the predecessor to the National Security Agency, is established.

Events.year: 1956 – In Operation Redwing, the first United States airborne hydrogen bomb is dropped over Bikini Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
Events.html: 1956 – In Operation Redwing, the first United States airborne hydrogen bomb is dropped over Bikini Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.

Events.year: 1964 – Discovery of the cosmic microwave background radiation by Robert Woodrow Wilson and Arno Penzias.
Events.html: 1964 – Discovery of the cosmic microwave background radiation by Robert Woodrow Wilson and Arno Penzias.

Events.year: 1967 – The Popular Movement of the Revolution political party is established in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.
Events.html: 1967 – The Popular Movement of the Revolution political party is established in the Democratic Republic of the Congo.

Events.year: 1969 – The Battle of Hamburger Hill in Vietnam ends.
Events.html: 1969 – The Battle of Hamburger Hill in Vietnam ends.

Events.year: 1971 – In the Chuknagar massacre, Pakistani forces massacre thousands, mostly Bengali Hindus.
Events.html: 1971 – In the Chuknagar massacre, Pakistani forces massacre thousands, mostly Bengali Hindus.

Events.year: 1980 – In a referendum in Quebec, the population rejects, by 60% of the vote, a government proposal to move towards independence from Canada.
Events.html: 1980 – In a referendum in Quebec, the population rejects, by 60% of the vote, a government proposal to move towards independence from Canada.

Events.year: 1983 – First publications of the discovery of the HIV virus that causes AIDS in the journal Science by Luc Montagnier.
Events.html: 1983 – First publications of the discovery of the HIV virus that causes AIDS in the journal Science by Luc Montagnier.

Events.year: 1983   – Church Street bombing: A car bomb planted by Umkhonto we Sizwe explodes on Church Street in South Africa's capital, Pretoria, killing 19 people and injuring 217 others.
Events.html: 1983 – Church Street bombing: A car bomb planted by Umkhonto we Sizwe explodes on Church Street in South Africa's capital, Pretoria, killing 19 people and injuring 217 others.

Events.year: 1985 – Radio Martí, part of the Voice of America service, begins broadcasting to Cuba.
Events.html: 1985 – Radio Martí, part of the Voice of America service, begins broadcasting to Cuba.

Events.year: 1989 – The Chinese authorities declare martial law in the face of pro-democracy demonstrations, setting the scene for the Tiananmen Square massacre.
Events.html: 1989 – The Chinese authorities declare martial law in the face of pro-democracy demonstrations, setting the scene for the Tiananmen Square massacre.

Events.year: 1990 – The first post-Communist presidential and parliamentary elections are held in Romania.
Events.html: 1990 – The first post-Communist presidential and parliamentary elections are held in Romania.

Events.year: 1996 – Civil rights: The Supreme Court of the United States rules in Romer v. Evans against a law that would have prevented any city, town or county in the state of Colorado from taking any legislative, executive, or judicial action to protect the rights of gays and lesbians.[8]
Events.html: 1996 – Civil rights: The Supreme Court of the United States rules in Romer v. Evans against a law that would have prevented any city, town or county in the state of Colorado from taking any legislative, executive, or judicial action to protect the rights of gays and lesbians.[8]

links.title: LGBT rights in the United States
Supreme Court of the United States

Events.year: 2002 – The independence of East Timor is recognized by Portugal, formally ending 23 years of Indonesian rule and three years of provisional UN administration (Portugal itself is the former colonizer of East Timor until 1976).
Events.html: 2002 – The independence of East Timor is recognized by Portugal, formally ending 23 years of Indonesian rule and three years of provisional UN administration (Portugal itself is the former colonizer of East Timor until 1976).

Events.year: 2012 – At least 27 people are killed and 50 others injured when a 6.0-magnitude earthquake strikes northern Italy.
Events.html: 2012 – At least 27 people are killed and 50 others injured when a 6.0-magnitude earthquake strikes northern Italy.

Events.year: 2013 – An EF5 tornado strikes the Oklahoma City suburb of Moore, killing 24 people and injuring 377 others.
Events.html: 2013 – An EF5 tornado strikes the Oklahoma City suburb of Moore, killing 24 people and injuring 377 others.

Events.year: 2019 – The International System of Units (SI): The base units are redefined, and the International Prototype Kilogram becomes obsolete.
Events.html: 2019 – The International System of Units (SI): The base units are redefined, and the International Prototype Kilogram becomes obsolete.
